snippet: New York City thinks that the key to transforming low-performing schools is to get parents to show up more, by turning the buildings into one-stop community centers.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's administration has invested heavily in its belief that increased parental engagement is key to turning around 62 low-performing schools New York State has targeted for takeover; has spent millions of dollars trying to entice parents to become more involved, marked difference from administration of former Mayor Michael Bloomberg, which focused on replacing bad teachers, principals and even whole schools.
lead_paragraph: New York City thinks that the key to transforming low-performing schools is to get parents to show up more, by turning the buildings into one-stop community centers.

headline.main: A Door-to-Door Push to Get Parents Involved at Struggling Schools
headline.print_headline: A Push to Involve Parents at Struggling Schools
